column1: #Text=FeTe0.5Se0.5 polycrystalline samples were synthesized by solid-state reaction method.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of Fe powder (Kojundo Chemical Laboratory, 99.9%), Te grains (same as above, 99.9999%), and Se grains (same as above, 99.9%) were weighed, mixed and ground with an agate mortar and pestle.
#Text=The mixing and grinding processes were carried out in nitrogen-filled glove box.
#Text=The ground powder was cold-pressed into pellets with 600 kg/cm2 uniaxial pressure.
#Text=The pellets were sealed in an evacuated quartz tube, and slowly ramped to 550°C in 5 hours from room temperature, and kept for 24 hours.

#Text=After cooling to room temperature naturally, the reacted pellets were reground, pressed (1800 kg/cm2 uniaxial pressure), sealed in a quartz tube, sintered again at 550°C for 24 h, and finally annealed at 400°C for 24 h, followed by quenching.
#Text=When the sintering temperature is lower than 500°C and higher than 400°C, although 11 phase can be formed, there are more impurities, and the superconducting volume fraction is very small.
